Package EasyNetworking.library

Class EasyMultiThreadedServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.ServerSocket
      • EasyNetworking.library.EasyServerSocket
        • EasyNetworking.library.EasyMultiThreadedServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public abstract class EasyMultiThreadedServer
extends EasyServerSocket

    EasyMultiThreadedServer - EasyMultiThreadedServer simplify the creation of multi threaded servers allowing multiple clients connect to a single server

    EasyMultiThreadedServer simplify the creation of multi threaded servers allowing multiple clients connect to a single server

    Since:
    2019-05-20
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Hitesh Ale
    See Also:
    EasyServerSocket, ServerHandler

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  EasyMultiThreadedServer.WorkerThread
      EasyMultiThreadedServer - EasyMultiThreadedServer.WorkerThread is used to run the Server code independently from the connection program so that multiple clients can connect at the same time

    • Constructor Detail

      • EasyMultiThreadedServer

        public EasyMultiThreadedServer​(int port)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This constructor calls the super(port); constructor of the EasyServerSocket Class and then sets the default timeout and then instantiates the workThreads ArrayList
        Parameters:
        port - This is where the Server will be located on the network
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This is due to the extension to EasyServerSocket
        See Also:
        EasyServerSocket

      • EasyMultiThreadedServer

        public EasyMultiThreadedServer​(int port,
                               java.lang.String serverName)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        This constructor calls the super(port); constructor of the EasyServerSocket Class and then sets the default timeout and then instantiates the workThreads ArrayList
        Parameters:
        port - This is where the Server will be located on the network
        serverName - look at EasyServerSocket serverName documentation
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - This is due to the extension to EasyServerSocket
        See Also:
        EasyServerSocket

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        public void accept​(boolean printOut)
        This method allows ONE Client to connect to the server. This method creates a new WorkerThread for the client and passes through a ServerHandler
        Overrides:
        accept in class EasyServerSocket
        Parameters:
        printOut - Determines if any of the Server connection info will be printed out
        See Also:
        IOException, ServerHandler

      • accept

        public void accept​(int timeout,
                   boolean printOut)
        This method allows ONE Client to connect to the server. This method creates a new WorkerThread for the client and passes through a ServerHandler, also modifies the default Timeout
        Overrides:
        accept in class EasyServerSocket
        Parameters:
        printOut - Determines if any of the Server connection info will be printed out
        timeout - This determines the number of millisecond that the Server will wait for a client before creating a new instance
        See Also:
        IOException, ServerHandler

      • getWorkerThreads

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Thread> getWorkerThreads()
        This method allows you to get the workerThreads ArrayList
        Returns:
        This returns the workerThreads ArrayList();

      • workerThreadImplementation

        public abstract void workerThreadImplementation​(ServerHandler handler)
        This method has to implemented by the user when instantiated an EasyMultiThreadServer. This method is the Server code that will run when a client connects to the Server
